description: T(n,k)=S(2n,n,k), 0<=k<=n, n >= 0, where S(p,q,r)=number of upright paths from (0,0) to (p,p-q) that do not rise above the line y=x-r.
comments: Let V=(e(1),...,e(n)) consist of q 1's and p-q 0's; let V(h)=(e(1),...,e(h)) and m(h)=(#1's in V(h))-(#0's in V(h)) for h=1,...,n. Then S(p,q,r)=number of V having r>=max{m(h)}.
formula: T(n, k)=Sum{t(n, j): 0<=j<=k}, array t as in A039599.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
